summary: The 'Well-Informed, Scientific, & Efficient Government Act of 2025' (WISE Government Act) aims to improve federal access to scientific literature and subscription services. It prohibits agencies from contracts that prevent disclosure of subscription costs. It mandates agencies to provide clear access policies for employees regarding library subscriptions. The bill requires the Administrator of General Services, in consultation with relevant stakeholders, to submit a report to Congress on increasing agency library access to serials, including cost surveys, issues, and recommendations. The bill defines key terms and clarifies that the act does not override Freedom of Information Act exemptions.
